ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Summary: A good overview of topics in the history of medicine in the United States in the 19th and 20th centuries-I would recommend the course as an excellent primer in the History of Medicine
I would recommend this course to any student interested in the history of medicine and public health, even tangentially.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: -I think my knowledge of the profession was deepenedboth through exposure to the works of very different authors, as well as through the discussion of professional issues (which was very helpful)-In terms of dissertation/research, the course was suggestive more than anything (exposing me to different methodologies, approaches and styles)

Coming out of this class, I feel confident about my budding knowledge of American medical history and prepared to undertake further study of it. Taking this class (again), I am sure, will prove to be one of the best decisions I made in grad school.
This course was directly relevant to my research and was tremendously useful.
